content: I'm hoping someone can help me debug this as I'm fairly new. #17988 is a fairly small PR adding the measurable Schroeder-Bernstein theorem and a supporting lemma. CI failed, with the error message saying there is a timeout in the file analysis/bounded_variation. I took a look, and at the line number pointed to by the error message, I don't see anything about measurability, so I'm not sure how my PR had an effect.

it seems that docs#evariation_on.add_point is very close to timing out and for some weird reason your changes pushed it over the threshold. Given the amount of linariths in that proof I am not surprised.
I see most of these uses of linarith are very simple: does that mean that we can gain a lot by replacing them by terms, or is linarith fast on easy goals too?
I think the only good answer to that is that you have to test it with the profiler
so should I replace the linariths as part of my PR?
In this case it's fair to use git blame and politely ask help from the author. In this case it means @Sebastien Gouezel
Well after some seemingly minor changes to my code, there is no longer a timeout, so I guess I'll mark this as resolved... :shrug:
Felix Weilacher has marked this topic as resolved.
@Felix Weilacher I'm working on removing the uses of linarith. Would you include the result in your PR?
Since my PR seems to be working fine for now, I think it would make more sense to have your changes be a separate PR.
The timeout happens again. @Rémi Bottinelli Is your PR ready? Thanks!
It's been merged already but it seems that's not enough?
